lidavidm commented on issue #6528: ARROW-7995: [C++] Add facility to coalesce and cache reads
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6528#issuecomment-594213930
 
 
   The API looks good to me. It might be even easier to use if you could then wrap a RandomAccessFile around a ReadRangeCache, depending on how complex it is to refactor (say) the Parquet reader's internals to use this.
   
   I'll take a closer look at the implementation when I get a chance.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #6528: ARROW-7995: [C++] Add facility to coalesce and cache reads
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6528#issuecomment-594466437
 
 
   Note this draft implementation starts reading it as soon as you tell it to cache ranges. @lidavidm Does that sound desirable or do you think reads should be lazy?
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #6528: ARROW-7995: [C++] Add facility to coalesce and cache reads
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6528#issuecomment-594475041
 
 
   By the way, it looks like the logic in `arrow::parquet` is upside down: it creates a new `RowGroupReader` for each column (see `FileColumnIterator`).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

lidavidm commented on issue #6528: ARROW-7995: [C++] Add facility to coalesce and cache reads
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6528#issuecomment-594516302
 
 
   > Note this draft implementation starts reading it as soon as you tell it to cache ranges. @lidavidm Does that sound desirable or do you think reads should be lazy?
   
   I'd say things should be eager up to a point; we should have some (configurable) global limit on prebuffered data so that a highly parallel or long-running process doesn't blow up memory usage, but we still want data to be loaded eagerly to get the performance benefits of prefetching data.
   
   (Of course, the limiting could be done at a higher level, e.g. datasets could limit how many files it reads from at once.)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #6528: ARROW-7995: [C++] Add facility to coalesce and cache reads
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6528#issuecomment-594532232
 
 
   Well, the logical place where to use this cache for now would be the Parquet `RowGroupReader` (hence my comment above about `parquet::arrow`).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

+#pragma once
+
+#include <cstdint>
+#include <memory>
+#include <string>
+#include <vector>
+
+#include "arrow/io/interfaces.h"
+#include "arrow/util/visibility.h"
+
+namespace arrow {
+namespace io {
+namespace internal {
+
+class ARROW_EXPORT ReadRangeCache {
+ public:
+  static constexpr int64_t kDefaultHoleSizeLimit = 4096;
+  static constexpr int64_t kDefaultRangeSizeLimit = 1 << 20;  // 1MB
+
+  explicit ReadRangeCache(std::shared_ptr<RandomAccessFile> file,
+                          int64_t hole_size_limit = kDefaultHoleSizeLimit,
+                          int64_t range_size_limit = kDefaultRangeSizeLimit);
+  ~ReadRangeCache();
+
+  // Cache the given ranges in the background.
+  // The ranges must not overlap with each other, nor with previously cached ranges.
+  Status Cache(std::vector<ReadRange> ranges);
 
 Review comment:
   Aside: since the IO happens asynchronously, it may be worth indicating under what circumstances an error Status would be returned here (i.e. only if ReadAsync fails to produce a Future -- though maybe not even, more on this below)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

 File path: cpp/src/arrow/io/interfaces.h

 @@ -200,7 +220,10 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT InputStream : virtual public FileInterface, virtual public Re
   InputStream() = default;
 };
 
-class ARROW_EXPORT RandomAccessFile : public InputStream, public Seekable {
+class ARROW_EXPORT RandomAccessFile
+    : public std::enable_shared_from_this<RandomAccessFile>,
 
 Review comment:
   I'd be OK with having `enable_shared_from_this` on `FileInterface`. Of course any API that uses `shared_from_this` somewhere in its call stack will need to make the user aware that they need to have a `shared_ptr` control block in order to use it

+#pragma once
+
+#include <cstdint>
+#include <memory>
+#include <string>
+#include <vector>
+
+#include "arrow/io/interfaces.h"
+#include "arrow/util/visibility.h"
+
+namespace arrow {
+namespace io {
+namespace internal {
+
+class ARROW_EXPORT ReadRangeCache {
+ public:
+  static constexpr int64_t kDefaultHoleSizeLimit = 4096;
+  static constexpr int64_t kDefaultRangeSizeLimit = 1 << 20;  // 1MB
 
 Review comment:
   I think either the default should be much larger (32MB?) or it should be unbounded (unbounded signaled by a negative number?). It's not necessarily obvious in the current (draft, yes, so this will be addressed in doxygen comments) that this object will coalesce adjacent blocks by default
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6528#discussion_r387905465
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/io/interfaces.cc
 ##########
 @@ -133,6 +140,15 @@ Status RandomAccessFile::ReadAt(int64_t position, int64_t nbytes,
 
 Status RandomAccessFile::GetSize(int64_t* size) { return GetSize().Value(size); }
 
+// Default ReadAsync() implementation: simply issue the read on one of the IO threads
+Result<Future<std::shared_ptr<Buffer>>> RandomAccessFile::ReadAsync(int64_t position,
+                                                                    int64_t nbytes) {
+  auto pool = internal::GetIOThreadPool();
 
 Review comment:
   Random thoughts: should the IO thread pool be an argument of `ReadAsync`? Or we could introduce an abstraction like `AsyncContext` (thinking out loud). I guess probably a good thing to mark all async APIs as experimental until a broader pattern can emerge

fields.description: This will be useful in order to improve Parquet reading performance on remote / high-latency filesystems.
fields.summary: [C++] IO: coalescing and caching read ranges
